    • Method Detail

      • evaluateDegreesOfFreedom

        public static double evaluateDegreesOfFreedom(double stdevOfMean,
                                              double mean)
        Evaluate degrees of freedom based on given mean and standard deviation of mean. Usually, stdevOfMean = stdev(x)/SQRT(N);N=number of measurements on variable X and stdev(x) is standard deviation (also known as individual stdev)!
        Parameters:
        stdevOfMean - standard deviation of mean
        mean - the mean
        Returns:
        degrees of freedom

      • evaluateDeviationOfDeviation

        public static double evaluateDeviationOfDeviation(double stdev,
                                                  double f)
        Evaluate deviation of a deviation based on given degrees of freedom and standard deviation (Gauss or Poisson or stdevOfMean). It is used in physics, in alpha, beta analysis.
        Parameters:
        stdev - standard deviation
        f - degrees of freedom
        Returns:
        deviation of a deviation

      • ttest

        public static boolean ttest(double ave1,
                            double ave2,
                            double sdevOfMean1,
                            double sdevOfMean2)
        Compute if two dataset (suposed they have the same pooled variance) have different means! Degrees of freedom are evaluated inside this method.
        Parameters:
        ave1 - , average means of dataset 1
        ave2 - , average means of dataset 2
        sdevOfMean1 - , standard deviation of mean 1
        sdevOfMean2 - , standard deviation of mean 2
        Returns:
        true if the input means are different, false otherwise!

      • ttest_default_unc

        public static boolean ttest_default_unc(double ave1,
                                        double ave2,
                                        double stdevOfMean1,
                                        double stdevOfMean2,
                                        double f1,
                                        double f2)
        Compute if two dataset (suposed they have the same pooled variance) have different means!
        Parameters:
        ave1 - , average means of dataset 1
        ave2 - , average means of dataset 2
        stdevOfMean1 - , standard deviation of mean of dataset 1
        stdevOfMean2 - , standard deviation of mean of dataset 2
        f1 - , degrees of freedom related to variance of dataset 1
        f2 - , degrees of freedom related to variance of dataset 2
        Returns:
        true if the input means are different, false otherwise!

      • ttest_default

        public static boolean ttest_default(double ave1,
                                    double ave2,
                                    double var1,
                                    double var2,
                                    double f1,
                                    double f2)
        Compute if two dataset (suposed they have the same pooled variance) have different means!
        Parameters:
        ave1 - , average means of dataset 1
        ave2 - , average means of dataset 2
        var1 - , variance (standard deviation = SQRT(variance)) of dataset 1
        var2 - , variance (standard deviation = SQRT(variance)) of dataset 2
        f1 - , degrees of freedom related to variance of dataset 1
        f2 - , degrees of freedom related to variance of dataset 2
        Returns:
        true if the input means are different, false otherwise!

      • ttest_deviation

        public static boolean ttest_deviation(double dev1,
                                      double dev2,
                                      double f1,
                                      double f2)
        Evaluate if two deviations (usually experimental standard deviation and theoretical standard deviation, in other words Gauss and Poisson respectively)are different. It is used in physics, in alpha, beta analysis.
        Parameters:
        dev1 - ,deviation 1 related to dataset (usually stdev Gauss or experimental)
        dev2 - ,deviation 2 related to dataset (usually stdev Poisson or theoretical)
        f1 - ,degrees of freedom related to variance 1 of dataset
        f2 - ,degrees of freedom related to variance 2 of dataset
        Returns:
        true if the input means are different, false otherwise!

      • ftest

        public static boolean ftest(double ave1,
                            double ave2,
                            double sdevOfMean1,
                            double sdevOfMean2)
        Fisher test used in physics. All required default data are computed inside method.
        Parameters:
        ave1 - , mean 1
        ave2 - , mean 2
        sdevOfMean1 - , standard deviation of mean 1
        sdevOfMean2 - , standard deviation of mean 2
        Returns:
        true if variances are different, false otherwise!

      • ftest_default

        public static boolean ftest_default(double var1,
                                    double var2,
                                    double f1,
                                    double f2)
        Fisher test. It is used in physics, in alpha, beta analysis.
        Parameters:
        var1 - , variance 1
        var2 - , variance 2
        f1 - , degrees of freedom related to variance 1
        f2 - , degrees of freedom related to variance 2
        Returns:
        true if the input variances are different, false otherwise!

      • ftest_deviation

        public static boolean ftest_deviation(double sdevOfMean1,
                                      double sdevOfMean2,
                                      double f1,
                                      double f2)
        Evaluate if two deviations (usually experimental standard deviation and theoretical standard deviation of mean in other words Gauss and Poisson respectively) are different. It is used in physics, in alpha, beta analysis.
        Parameters:
        sdevOfMean1 - ,standard deviation of mean 1 related to dataset (usually Gauss or experimental)
        sdevOfMean2 - ,standard deviation of mean 2 related to dataset (usually Poisson or theoretical)
        f1 - , degrees of freedom related to deviation 1
        f2 - , degrees of freedom related to deviation 2
        Returns:
        true if the input deviations are different, false otherwise!

      • getStudentFactor

        public static double getStudentFactor(double df)
        Get the coverage factor for final result expressed as mean +/- t multiply by the standard deviation of mean. Usually, degrees of freedom are computed as n-1 where n is the number of measurements on x variable. Equation is: result(or simply X) = MEAN(x) +/- t * STDEV(x)/SQRT(n). STDEV(x)/SQRT(n) is also known as standard deviation of mean!
        Parameters:
        df - , degrees of freedom
        Returns:
        t, student factor

      • getDegreesOfFreedomFromStudentFactor

        public static double getDegreesOfFreedomFromStudentFactor(double tst)
        Return degrees of freedom related to the coverage factor (student t factor, two-tailed) involving in extended uncertainty value!!
        Parameters:
        tst - student factor
        Returns:
        f - degrees of freedom

      • getGlobalVariance

        public static double getGlobalVariance(double[] ab,
                                       double[] f)
        Computes the global variance of n stdev! It is used in physics, in alpha, beta measurements.
        Parameters:
        ab - the standard deviation array
        f - the associated array of degrees of freedom
        Returns:
        the global variance.

      • getEffectiveDegreesOfFreedom

        public static double getEffectiveDegreesOfFreedom(double abcompus,
                                                  double[] ab,
                                                  double[] f)
        Welch - Satterwaite formula for computing the degrees of freedom. If f=f(x1...xn) and if s1,...sn are the related uncertainties for variables x1,...xn then: abcompus^2=SUMi=1,n(df/dxi)^2*si^2+2*SUMi=1,n-1SUMj=i+1,N((df/dxi)*(df/dxj)*si*sj*rij); rij=correlation coefficient. It is used in physics, in alpha, beta measurements.
        Parameters:
        abcompus - the final uncertainty based on error propagation formula described above
        ab - array are individual uncertainties of variables which are contained in the final formula. e.g. A=Net/eff where Net and eff present individual uncertainties.
        f - array are degrees of freedom associated with ab array uncertainties.
        Returns:
        the final overall degrees of freedom associated with final uncertainty abcompus.

      • getDataCorrelation

        public static double getDataCorrelation(double[] x,
                                        double[] y)
        Computes the correlation coefficient for 2 datasets.
        Parameters:
        x - the 1st dataset
        y - the 2nd dataset
        Returns:
        the correlation coefficient

      • getWeightedMean

        public static double getWeightedMean(double[] x,
                                     double[] sx)
        Weighted mean based on default weight w. It is used in physics, in alpha, beta measurements, when we have several results of a variable (activity) each result having its own uncertainty. The overall final result is computed by weighted mean!!
        Parameters:
        x - the array of means
        sx - the array of their uncertainties
        Returns:
        the weighted mean.

      • getWeightedDeviation

        public static double getWeightedDeviation(double[] sx)
        Weighted uncertainty based on default weight w. It is used in physics, in alpha, beta measurements.
        Parameters:
        sx - the array of uncertainties
        Returns:
        the weighted uncertainty

      • getStudentFactorForMeanComparison

        public static double getStudentFactorForMeanComparison(double df)
        Get the Student factor for mean comparison of two datasets.
        Parameters:
        df - , degrees of freedom
        Returns:
        t, student factor

      • getFisherFactor

        public static double getFisherFactor(double df1,
                                     double df2)
        Get the Fisher factor according to the degrees of freedom and the required confidence level.
        Parameters:
        df1 - , degrees of freedom for dataset 1
        df2 - , degrees of freedom for dataset 2
        Returns:
        t, Fisher factor
